description.narrative: Over the past five decades in Myanmar, the regime-led political system of the country has been a vehicle of structural and institutional violence against women. Early 2011 changes in the political and socio-economic situation began to pave the way for representation of women candidates in legislative bodies and administrative branches, but it is extremely limited due to relatively lower educational attainment as well as less experience in institutional/ organizational/ community/ public decision-making; attitude, perception, and low self-esteem of women.The project objectives are; - Disseminate information on gender equality and raise gender based violence awareness of CSOs and community members among rights holders and duty bearers in target communities - Strengthen networks and alliances with Gender Focal Persons/Media Focal persons, Gender Network/GBV Team and CSOs for advocacy to combat gender based violence and collaborative actions in order to develop advocacy strategies at different level - Support documentation, publication and broadcasting by integrating gender into IEC materials and media channels to reduce GBV - Thingaha as a registered organization as well as gender equitable organization offers gender related effective to consultancy services to organizations and agencies. The outcomes of each intervention will be observable and beneficial to target CSOs, and community members among rights holders and duty bearers. Thingaha expects that strengthening gender capacity of CSOs, Gender/Media Focal persons and Gender Network/GBV Team will affect significant change to reduce gender based violence issues in target communities. Additionally, evidence-based advocacy will be convincing to supporters of social justice among the Duty Bearers. Thingaha will make sure to raise awareness on gender equality, gender based violence issues, gender and development, human rights, women’s rights and women’s empowerment among the target communities, groups and CSOs. Thingaha will uniquely promote positive masculinity as a driving force to build a peaceful society, strong partnership between women and men, strengthen leadership that promote freedom, justice, peace and harmony.
This project mainly contributes to results within Combating gender based violence. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity
